page.title: 08SAVE BLEASDALE SCHOOL
page.content:
In February 1984 Lancs. Education Sub-Committee proposed to close six schools in Wyre District. Bleasdale C.of E. was one of them.
Immediately an Action Committee was formed consisting of parents, governors, friends and teachers to present a case for the retention of the school.
The main argument against closure was concern for childrens safety and welfare when travelling great distances to other schools particularly in bad weather.
We were very pleased that our campaign was successful and the Education Committee decided to proceed no further.
